summary:
This is a Patch with brief tutorial to help you get a HUGE boost in your Skyrim performance. As a result, everything will look 10 times better. And the game will run so smoothly, you will be greatly amazed. Almost everyone can benefit from this patch. It is definitely a must-have.


A simple .pdf, or .doc, file is also available.
descriptionHtml:

[url=https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=fr&js=y&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fmods%2F59305%2F%3F&edit-text=&act=url][b][size=3]FRENCH[/size][/b] [/url][size=2][b][font=Verdana][font=Georgia][b]||[/b][/font][/font][/b][/size] [color=#d5a6bd]FRANÇAIS[/color]


[color=#ffff00][b]Description[/b][/color]                                                                     
[size=3]
[color=#fff2cc]This is an easy to [size=3]use Patch[size=3][size=3]. You need this Patch if you want a better frame rate[size=3], a better[size=3] looking landscape, and interiors, and bodies.[/size][/size][/size] [size=3]I[/size]f you prefer a more detailed process,  I have included a [size=3][size=3].Pdf[size=3], or a .doc,[/size][/size] file explaining [size=3]a[/size] [size=3]step by step procedure[/size][/size][/size][/size][/color][/size][size=3].[/size] This booster may seem frivolous, but I would have payed to [size=3]know th[size=3]ese secrets [/size][/size]before. I have gained more than 15 frames per second outside Whiterun. Look at the images.

The .pdf[size=3], or .doc, [/size]file is a brief tutorial to help you get a HUGE boost in your Skyrim's performance. As a result, everything will look 10 times better. And the game will run smoother, faster, and it will look amazing, especially if you are currently averaging around 15 frames per second[size=3], or "less". [/size] So simple, YET very powerful. (See the center image above, the FPS is 60.1 .)
[center][/center][center][size=3][img]http://s29.postimg.org/hvdwzjrfb/fps.jpg[/img][/size][/center][size=3]
[color=#fff2cc]There is no shortcut that meets these "results". Changing values in any .ini file does NOT do it as good[size=3] --[/size] [size=3]R[/size]educing fade distance does NOT do it[size=3] -- [/size]Using Grass o[size=3]n[/size] steriods does [size=3]NOT do it[size=3] --[/size] [size=3]U[/size]sing another grass mod[size=3] does NOT do it[/size] [size=3]--[/size][/size] Reducing decals does NOT do it. This IS IT. It does not get better than this[size=3], f[size=3]or "looks" and "performance"![/size][/size][/color]

[size=2][i][b][color=#00ffff][size=2][size=2]WHO THIS MOD IS FOR:
[color=#ff00ff](NOTE:  IF YOU HAVE A BOOTLEG SKYRIM COPY, please do not ask me how to install this mod, or you'll not be answered.)[/color]

[/size][/size][/color][/b][/i][/size][color=#fff2cc][size=3][size=3]This m[size=3]od is for those who have[size=3] taken time to make their Skyrim look aw[size=3]esome[size=3], but are now suffering [size=3]a decrease inframe rate. These are the wonderful people who want to make Skyrim look exactly the way they want it to. This is not for those who have done nothing to Skyrim and who [size=3]already have a very high frame rate. [size=3]It goes with needing to say, if you do not use a mod like Skyrim Flo[size=3]ra Overhaul to [size=3]add plants and flowers and trees, and your frame rate outside is high[size=3]er [size=3]tha[size=3]n [size=3]40 FPS[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/color][/size] then you may [size=3]already have [size=3]a high performance set up.[/size][/size][color=#fff2cc] [size=2](If you don't know how to see frame rate, I would recommend downloading an app like Bandicam.)[/size]

The other methods for [size=3]"reducing" frame rate[/size] are what I term "destructive", meaning they take away beauty rather than enhancing it. For example, reducing fade distance: it would also remove other vegetation and leave you with [size=3]large,[/size] very ugly empty spots, where grass and vegetation are missing until you get close enough, then they'll suddenly "pop" in, totally distracting you from immersion.

Other performance boost mods "sacrifice quality" to increase performance. I don't want to do that to my Skyrim, and I don't want you to do that to yours. I want to have high quality and high performance.

This is an artistic "surgical procedure", where I gently guide your hand while instructing you, to give you  beautiful results. I wouldn't give you something I wouldn't use myself. I have a high-end computer, and I still use it. My logic is, why have extra grass for looks if it slows down the frame rate, if slowing down the frame rate makes it look bad? So I needed a technique for doing this.

[size=3]One of the am[size=3]azing things you[size=3]''l[size=3]l enjoy about this is how much better [size=3]frame rate is better [b]anywhere [/b]you  go in Skyrim, even in places that have dense vegetation [size=3] and many trees. You wi[size=3]ll go into the forest, stand next to a rushing river, and see that everything look[size=3]s better than ever[size=3][size=3].[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/color] Even [size=3]the Dungeons and Caves[size=3] loo[size=3]k be[size=3]tter and have a higher frame rate[size=3].[/size] [size=3]S[/size]in[size=3]ce [size=3]y[size=3]our [size=3]Skyrim is not working so hard to do its job outside, it [size=3]has more vitality to do its job inside.[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size]

This modification also Fixes many problems you might be having with Unique Ground covers, as you can see: 
http://alturl.com/8p8ir

This is a MUST HAVE for anyone who wants better frame rates and better textures. I[size=3]'ve used this mod [size=3]myself[size=3], several time[size=3]s during test [size=3]re-installation[size=3]s,[/size][/size][/size] and I love it!  It saves me time[size=3], and it's so convenient[size=3].[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size]

[size=3][b][size=4]
[color=#ffff00] Skyrim Performance Booster Patch[/color] [/size][/b]
[color=#fff2cc] [size=3][size=2][size=2]T[/size][/size][/size]o[size=3] make this eas[size=3]y for those who don't [size=3]wa[size=3]nt to read the [size=3].pdf or .doc file, I have included a Patch. If the patch does not work for you, you WILL have to read the [size=3].pdf or .doc and follow the instructions. If it appears to [size=3]be stuck[/size], close it and [size=3]restart it. Then, give it a few minutes to do its job.[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/color][/size]

[size=3][b][size=4][color=#ffff00]The Big Question: How Does [size=4]It Work?[/size][/color][/size][/b][/size]
[color=#fff2cc]This question has been the most [size=3]popular question yet. Sadly, it has been by people who don't care [size=3]to use the mod. Because, if they had, they would have read the PDF[size=3], or DOC, file and learned how the mod works.[/size][/size][/size] The documentation extensively [size=3]lays out[size=3] not only the dynamics, but also the methods to control the power it[size=3]self with your own t[size=3]wo hands[size=3], [size=3]so that it can be tailored [size=3]to meet the needs of your computer. [size=3]I have spent many hours putting all of this together for your benefit, because YOU deserve better.  I hope you will not only enjoy it, but also show courtesy when posting comments here[size=3].[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/color] [size=3]The Patch is for those who don't want to spend time reading[size=3] these documents. I use the patch myself.[/size][/size]

[size=3][size=5][size=3][size=3][b][size=4][color=#ffff00]Load Order[/color][/size][/b][/size][/size][/size][/size]
[color=#fff2cc]The best load order is:  (1) Skyrim Flora Overhaul  (2) all other Skyrim Flora Overhaul addons (e.g. Dawnguard, Dragonborn, etc.)   3. Unique Grasses   4. UG Plugin (Unique Grasses Plugin).[/color]

[center][color=#93c47d](Videos might be visible only on the ENGLISH page.)[/color][/center]
[center][youtube]zNZelT-vhMw[/youtube][/center]

[size=4][b][color=#ff0000]Posting Comments[/color][/b][/size]
[color=#fff2cc]Comments have been disabled due to abuse. Sorry for any inconvenience. I may be reached via messenger if you have any questions. Thank you for your participation.[/color]
[size=5]

[/size][size=3][size=2][i][b][color=#00ffff][size=2][size=2][size=6][size=6][size=6][size=5]Windows 8 Patch and Custom Windows Patch Now Available !
[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/color][/b][/i][/size][/size][size=3][size=3][color=#fff2cc][size=3]This new patch is for YOU if you have windows 8, OR if you have a custom Skyrim windows set[size=3]-[/size]up[/size][/color][color=#fff2cc]. In other words,  if you have installed Skyrim in another location,  other than the default location,  USE THIS PATCH. The way to [size=3]use it is simple. Place it into your Steam folder[size=3], which is the SAME folder as the one that has the "SteamApps"[/size][/size] folder. Then click it But, be sure to read the instructions. 
[/color]
[/size][/size][i][b][color=#00ffff][size=2][size=2][size=6][size=5]Windows 10 Support
[/size][/size][/size][/size][/color][/b][/i]For anyone using Windows 10, I HAVE MORE GREAT NEWS !  I am excited to say, The Performance Booster Patch will work !  Just grab the latest patch designed for Windows 8, and use it. Just be sure you carefully read the instructions on how to use it.

[i][b][color=#00ffff][size=2][size=2]
[/size][/size][/color][/b][/i][size=3][size=3][color=#fff2cc]Within the PDF/DOC I've added a [size=3]FULL INSTALL section to include all files necessa[size=3]ry for a jaw dropping Skyrim. Not only will th[size=3]ings run fast and smooth, but the females and m[size=3]ales will have amazing looking bodies. The females are setup to d[size=3]isplay [size=3] [/size] exceptional   HDT [/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/color][/size][/size][color=#fff2cc] movements. Please note, not all HDT's are the same, and this arrangement I have made is The Best.

Watch this video for DEMO of HDT and also how Skyrim Performance Booster has improved my frame rate enough to provide me with an HD gaming experience: [/color] ([size=3][size=3][b][i][color=#27F557]Click to watch this HD Video[/color][/i][/b][/size][/size])
[center][/center][center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/videos/3914/?][img]http://s27.postimg.org/ruu3218xv/prettyface_th.jpg[/img][/url][/center][b]
[/b][size=3][color=#00ff00][b]DOWNLOAD[/b][/color]
[color=#fff2cc][size=3]I update this file often, because perfect isn't perfect enough for me[size=3]. (Hence...12 updates so far.[size=3]) [/size]So you [size=3]"might" be downloading the file during the update process, and that MIGHT leave you with a [size=3]file that doesn't work. [size=3]Easy Solution my friend: [/size] download t[size=3]he file again[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/color][/size][color=#fff2cc]! And check back later for any new update, you won't want[size=3] to miss.[/size][/color]

[size=3][b][i][color=#27F557]The Booster Patches come in 2 Flavors:[/color][/i][/b][/size]
[size=3][i][b][color=#00ffff]       Skyrim Performance Booster (Regular)[/color][/b][/i] [size=3]: for those who want a nice boost in performance[/size]
       [i][b][color=#00ffff]Skyrim Performance Booster (Max)[/color][/b][/i][/size] :[size=3] for those who want to go all the way, "pedal to the floor"...Skyrim. Regular Patch must be used first.[/size]

[size=3][size=3][b][i][color=#27F557][color=#00ff00]WARNING[/color][size=3][color=#00ff00]:[/color]
[/size][/color][/i][/b][/size][/size][color=#ea9999][size=3][size=3][size=3][size=3][size=3]I[size=3]f[/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/color][color=#ea9999] you add another tree mod, like Aspen Trees, you will likely wreck your SFO tree LOD, and your distant trees will look like junk. If you have already done it, just unistall the "other" tree mod, then reinstall SFO, Unique Grasses and G.C., and Unique Grasses and G.C. Plugin again. Then run the Patch.

I should also tell you that if you use an ENB, and you still need more frames per second, try disabling Ambient Occlusion. Not all ENB's are equal. Some ENB's are more power hungry than others. Some need ambient occlusion turned on for better 3d effects, while others do not. And well tuned Skyrim configuration .ini files can even help your ENB perform better.[/color]

[size=2][size=3][b][color=#ffff00][size=3][size=5]VERSIONS[/size]
[/size][/color][/b][/size][/size][color=#fff2cc]Please note that all references to Skyrim Flora Overhaul, and Unique Grasses and Groundcovers, and Unique Grasses and Groundcovers Plugin apply to
the "Versions"[color=#00ffff] [b][size=3]upto the date 10/1/14[/size][/b][/color]. Although you are welcome to experiment with updates to those Mods, I cannot guarantee they will have the same outcome expected by Skyrim Performance Booster. Note: I have noticed different results from different versions of SFO, so maybe you'll want to experiment to see which results you like the most.[/color]
[color=#00ff00]
[size=3][size=3][b][i]Green Grass[/i][/b][/size][/size][/color]
[size=3][color=#fff2cc][size=3]Want green grass instead of brown grass, try my friend Renthal's grass. Install it AFTER you run The Skyrim Performance Booster Patch, or after you have made changes according to the instructions provided in the guide.[/size][/color][/size]  (Recent Notice: Renthal311 has removed his vast collection of files, but the all in one file can be downloaded here:  [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/80722/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D80722&pUp=1]Flora Mod Collection[/url].) I have still listed his file, because it is worthy of appreciation: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75258/?]REAL GRASS for Skyrim.)
[/url]

[size=2][size=3][b][color=#ffff00]COMPLEMENTARY:   JW's Skyrim Tweak Guide is Now Available for Download[/color][/b][/size][/size]
[color=#fff2cc]Now take the Performance Booster to an all new high with this Guide. JW's Tweak Guide will show you many tricks for getting your SKyrim up to cutting edge performance. Added note: AMD users may like to read up on OpenCL Drivers and what they do and how to get them. And, GeForce users may like to read up on Physx Drivers, and Cuda Drivers, what they do and how to install them.[/color]

[b][color=#ffff00]More Tools[/color][/b][size=2]
[color=#fff2cc]I SERIOUSLY  recommend you install this other file with it, for BEST results:[/color]
                                            [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59292/?][b]JW's Skyrim Configuration Files[/b][/url].  [size=3][b][color=#ffff00]ANOTHER FEATURED HOTFILE![/color][/b][size=2]
             [color=#fff2cc]Why[size=2] use the Config. files? Because [size=2]they will add just the right amount of veg[size=2]et[size=2]ation and shading for this boo[size=2]ster. Do it[size=2] [size=2]yes yes[size=2]![/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/size][/color][/size][/size][/size]
[color=#fff2cc]
And for those who want to gain powerful control over their ENB, or who want to start using ENB, I recommend: [/color] [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59253/]SKYRIM ENB GUIDE[/url].
[color=#fff2cc]And for those who have muscle PC's, here's an ENB preset that will go perfectly with all JW packages:[/color] [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59286/]JW's High Quality ENB Preset[/url].



           [color=#fff2cc]++++++++++++++ Remember, after this install, run from Whiterun to Riverwood, so you can see the landscapes. ENJOY!!! ++++++++++++++ [/color]
